subject: Philosophy
title: Consent of the Governed
description: A quick, practical guide to Consent of the Governed.

hook.text: Did you ever sign a contract agreeing to be governed? No. So why must you obey the law?

buildup.text: Social contract theory says legitimacy comes from the consent of the governed.

discovery.text: But consent is tricky. You didn't choose to be born here. Tacit consent â€” staying â€” is the best argument.

twist.text: Critics ask: can you truly consent if leaving isn't a real option? Where would you go?

climax.text: The consent problem has never been fully solved. Democracy approximates consent but doesn't guarantee it.

punchline.text: You never agreed to the rules. But you live by them anyway.

quiz.question: What is the main problem with 'consent of the governed'?
options: Most people never explicitly consented to their government
Everyone signs a social contract at birth
